thread.title: Colin Miller ejected, Alexander Burmistrov stretchered off after hit
thread.title_full: Colin Miller ejected, Alexander Burmistrov stretchered off after hit

title: Colin Miller ejected, Alexander Burmistrov stretchered off after hit
text:
Tweet Feb 28, 2017; Boston, MA, USA; Arizona Coyotes center Alexander Burmistrov (91) is tended to by medical personnel after colliding into Boston Bruins defenseman Colin Miller (6) during the second period at TD Garden. Greg M. Cooper-USA TODAY Sports 
The Boston Bruins-Arizona Coyotes game came to a halt at the 16:11 mark in the second period after a scary-looking situation on the TD Garden ice. 
B’s defenseman Colin Miller leveled Alexander Burmistrov with a hard hit near the blue line. Burmistrov remained down on the ice for quite some time before he was taken off the ice on a stretcher. 
Here’s a couple looks at the controversial play: 
Colin Miller ejected for this hit on Burmistrov pic.twitter.com/ZgbDRtBFZO 
— Pete Blackburn (@PeteBlackburn) March 1, 2017 
Another look at Miller’s hit on Burmistrov pic.twitter.com/gJBP3xGu9J 
— Pete Blackburn (@PeteBlackburn) March 1, 2017 
Miller was given a game misconduct and was ejected for the hit. Burmistrov gave two thumbs up as he was stretchered off. 
This article first appeared on NESN.com and was syndicated with permission.
